The activity of MASKIN & ELEKTRO CO. LTD has not
stopped at selling taperecorders and equipment. For half a
year now the company has been producing prerecorded tape
»Swedish Phonotape». This new type of »music in the home»
has become very popular in a short time in U. S. and also
the European market evidences great demand.
Compared to grammophone records, the prerecorded tape
has many great advantages.
The tape can be played indefinitely without any deterioration
of any kind, whereas a grammophone- record loses the diigh
frequences after playing a few times. Very few homes have
a record player of high enough class to reproduce the highest
frequences. A good taperecorder however has a frequency
response giving all frequences audiable to the human ear.
Prerecorded tape therefore gives greater possibilities of re¬
producing music in the home.
Furthermore the tape is practically proof against wear out.
If and when the owner is tired of a recording, he just can
use it for a new recording. A grammophone record, when
it is out — well it is out.
PHONOTAPE
Every owner of a taperecorder has the opportunity to make
his own recordings by microphone or radio, though there
are great difficulties in ensuring the highest sound quality.
The radio transmitters have a limited frequency range and the
receivers are sensitive to different kinds of distortion. Re¬
cordings by microphone are a little scientific. Of course
everybody owning a taperecorder can make a recording from
an orchestra and get good reproducing but in order to get a
perfect recording of the highest class, expensive microphones
and acoustically balanced studios must
be used. The prerecorded tape has
therefore met a great demand all over
the world. The very best orchestras and
the most high class equipments are used
and clever technicians arrange the placing
of the microphones in the acoustically
balanced studios when prerecorded tape
is produced. Furthermore the taperecor¬
der owner is offered his choice from
a large tape library including those
pieces of music he is most likely to
want.
PHONOTAPE
In order to produce high classed pre-'
recorded tape M & E has built a recor¬
ding studio. This studio was constructed
to the high standards with help of the
progress evolved by the most recent
acoustical research.
La. the sound is moderated by special
treatment of the ceiling and the walls.
An echo chamber is connected to the
studio, so that the acoustical balance can
be regulated as desired. A complete set
of professional recording equipments is
installed in the technician’s room, where
are employed Ampex professional record¬
ing machines, mixers and amplifiers
of different types. An Ampex dubbing
machine is used to produce the copies.
